<section begin=summary />The '''Expansive Truth-Seeking Ball''' is a Kekkei Mōra ninjutsu used by Kaguya Ōtsutsuki. It is composed of all five elemental [[Nature Transformation|nature transformations]] as well as [[Yin–Yang Release]].<ref name="chpt689">''Naruto'' chapter 689, page 7</ref><section end=summary />

== Usage ==
Kaguya Ōtsutsuki used the [[God Tree]] to absorb chakra from all the people trapped inside the [[God: Nativity of a World of Trees]] technique to create a maximised [[Truth-Seeking Ball]]. A vast expanding mass of chaos with power to reshape the world by obliterating it to nothing first. Unlike the standard Truth-Seeking Ball, which a user starts with a set amount of spheres that cannot be regenerated if lost or destroyed, this technique does not have such limitations and can be generated from nothing.

The sphere will continue to expand until it overwrites the previous dimension, completely annihilating it. If this happens, even previously synced [[Space–Time Ninjutsu]] will be unable to return to the new dimension.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 689, pages 7-8</ref>

== Trivia ==
* In the original publication of [[I Love You|chapter 689]], [[Black Zetsu]] lists [[Wood]] as one of the component natures of the Expansive Truth-Seeking Balls, rather than [[Water]].<ref name="chpt689"/> [[Masashi Kishimoto]] confirmed this was an error in Issue #41 of ''Weekly Shōnen Jump'', and stated that it would be corrected in the [[I Love You (volume)|tankōbon release]] of the chapter.<ref>Weekly Shōnen Jump Issue 41 Author Comments</ref>

'''Explosive Clay''' is the characteristic skill of [[Deidara]], first used during his career as a terrorist bomber, and later as a member of [[Akatsuki]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 359, page 6</ref>

== Overview ==
Deidara holds the belief that "art" is the moment in which something that has form is destroyed. In order to pursue this view, as well as to apply it towards combat,<ref name="d3"/> he stole a [[kinjutsu]] passed down in [[Iwagakure]] that allows its user to knead [[chakra]] into materials.<ref>''[[Sha no Sho]]'', page 105</ref> Deidara feeds clay to one of his body's mouths – most commonly the mouth on his left palm – giving them shape and turning them into explosives. The power and type of explosion is determined by the chakra that he applies to the clay.<ref name="d3"/> In ''[[Akatsuki Hiden]]'', the quality of the clay is also an important consideration, as inferior clays won't take the exact form that Deidara intends nor will their detonation be as impressive. The white clay used in [[Ceramic Village]] for [[Hanasaki]] ceramics is the best clay Deidara has found.

The explosives are initially palm-sized, making them easy to prepare in advance and then carry into combat.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 248, page 3</ref> To make practical use of them, however, it is necessary that Deidara enlarge them. This in turn brings the clay creation to life, which Deidara can control remotely depending on how large it was made: an average-sized bird can be sent flying at an opponent as an attack;<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 249, page 15</ref> a large bird can be used as a form of transportation, and once he reaches his destination he can send it flying at an opponent as an attack.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 356, pages 9-10</ref> To detonate the clay, he makes the [[Seal of Confrontation]] and says {{translation|"''katsu''"|喝}}.<ref name="d3"/>

Because Deidara relies on his clay to make his explosives, running out of clay severely limits his options in battle.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 249, page 2</ref> Low chakra reserves also place Deidara at a disadvantage, as his mouths will struggle to shape the clay into usable forms.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 361, page 4</ref> Deidara's clay is all earth-based, meaning that opponents can defuse the explosives with [[Lightning Release]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 361, pages 13-14</ref>

=== Clay Ranking ===
Deidara ranks his clay by number, similar in fashion to the [[Wikipedia:Composition C|Composition C]] line of explosives:
* '''[[C1]]''': Deidara's weakest explosive, these most often take the form of birds or insects. They are usually kept at a small size, making them ideal for sneak attacks or other covert operations.<ref name="d3"/> C1 is produced using one of the mouths in Deidara's palms.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 357, pages 10-11</ref>
* '''[[C2]]''': a large, flight-capable dragon. Deidara rides atop it while it fires "smart bombs", smaller dragons that pursue their targets. The dragon also produces clay mines, which are used to force opponents to fight in a limited space.<ref name="d3"/> C2 is produced using both of the mouths in Deidara's palm.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 357, page 15</ref>
* '''[[C3]]''': a roughly human-shaped statue that Deidara drops on targets from above. They are designed to specifically maximise their destructive power, which is supposed to be great enough to destroy an entire [[Sunagakure|village]].<ref name="d3"/>
* '''[[C4]]''': a giant doll, shaped like Deidara himself. When it ruptures, it releases a cloud of microscopic bombs, too small to be seen. When these bombs are inhaled, they flood the victim's bloodstream and detonate, destroying them at a cellular level.<ref name="d3"/> C4 is created using Deidara's normal mouth.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 359, pages 16-17</ref>
* '''[[C0]]''': Deidara's {{translation|"Ultimate Art"|究極芸術|Kyūkyoku Geijutsu}}. Deidara draws in chakra from every corner of his body to turn himself into a bomb. Everything within ten kilometres is destroyed, but Deidara dies in the process. C0 is created using the mouth on Deidara's chest, which is connected directly to his heart.<ref>''[[Sha no Sho]]'', page 262</ref>

== Trivia ==
* {{translation|''[[Wikipedia:Katsu (Zen)|Katsu]]''|喝}} is a type of shout that is used in [[Wikipedia:Zen|Zen]] Buddhism to stop the discursive thoughts of practitioners, potentially helping them achieve an [[Wikipedia:Kensho|enlightenment experience]]. It is also used as a means of focusing energy.
** In the English dub, Deidara's cry of "katsu" is omitted with a mere grunt instead.
* [[Naruto]] referred to the Explosive Clay as a kinjutsu of Iwagakure.<ref>''Boruto'' episode 78</ref>

When, for whatever reason, the user [[Hiding in Mist Technique|cannot find]] a target, they use this technique to [[Summoning Technique|summon]] a pack of [[ninken]] underground. The ninken use their superior sense of smell to track the target, converge on their location, and then all together burst from the ground and take hold with their fangs. With the target captured in this way, the summoner can easily locate them and finish them off.<ref name="d1"/>

During [[Kakashi Hatake]]'s fight with [[Zabuza Momochi]], he allows Zabuza to injure him a few times so that Zabuza's weapons will be coated with his blood. He then smears some of his blood on a scroll, holds the scroll in his hands as he performs the [[hand seal]]s, and presses the scroll to the ground as he summons the ninken. Rather than track down Zabuza's scent, the ninken track the scent of Kakashi's blood to Zabuza.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 29</ref> When [[Haku]] later damages the scroll, the summoning is ended prematurely and the ninken disappear, thus releasing Zabuza.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 30, page 15</ref>

'''Truth-Seeking Balls''' are orbs of malleable black [[chakra]], which can alter their form and characteristics in various ways. Though only the size of a fist, each hides within it the power to obliterate an entire forest.<ref name="d4"/>

== Acquisition ==
Those who awaken [[Six Paths Senjutsu]] are able to wield Truth-Seeking Balls.<ref name="d4"/> [[Hagoromo]] and [[Hamura Ōtsutsuki]] appear to have possessed this power naturally,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 690, page 4</ref> whereas others may obtain it by [[Six Paths Ten-Tails Coffin Seal|becoming]] the [[jinchūriki]] of the [[Ten-Tails]], or by receiving it directly from Hagoromo. Entering [[Tenseigan Chakra Mode]] also grants the user Truth-Seeking Balls.<ref name="The Last">''[[The Last: Naruto the Movie]]''</ref>

The number of Truth-Seeking Balls acquired varies from user to user. Acquisition method may determine the number, as both [[Obito Uchiha]] and [[Madara Uchiha]] gained ten orbs upon becoming the Ten-Tails' jinchūriki; Obito initially only formed two,<ref name="c639">''Naruto'' chapter 639, pages 6-8</ref> obtaining the other eight upon gaining control of the Ten-Tails' power.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 640, page 14</ref> Upon receiving power from Hagoromo, [[Naruto Uzumaki]], instead gained nine orbs,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 674, page 1</ref> while [[Asura Ōtsutsuki]] only showed five orbs,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 670, page 17</ref> nine orbs in the anime.<ref>''Naruto: Shippūden'' episode 468</ref> [[Toneri Ōtsutsuki]] is depicted with an inconsistent amount.<ref name="The Last"/> Due to having previously been the Ten-Tails' jinchūriki,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 666, page 6</ref> Obito was able to manifest a single Truth-Seeking Ball after  [[Chakra Absorption Techniques|absorbing]] some of Madara's [[Six Paths Chakra|power]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 665, pages 16-17</ref>

== Usage ==
When not in use, Truth-Seeking Balls generally float behind the user's back in a circular formation, though two of Obito's float behind his hands,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 643, page 4</ref> Hagoromo's float beneath him while levitating,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 670, page 2</ref> and Hamura's instead form a sigmoidal formation.<ref name="The Last"/> The orbs are always on standby once created,<ref name="c669">''Naruto'' chapter 669, pages 6-7</ref> and users cannot create additional orbs after the initial acquisition number; thus, orbs that are lost for whatever reason cannot be replaced. In Naruto's case, the orbs currently under his control disappear and reappear alongside his [[Six Paths Sage Mode|chakra cloak]],<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 695, page 4</ref> while the orbs he has discarded remain active.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 660, page 10</ref> [[Clone]]s are not created with orbs of their own,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 675, page 10</ref> though the user can temporarily transfer them to a clone.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 686, pages 10-11</ref>

Truth-Seeking Balls encompass the power of all five basic [[nature]]s,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 689, page 5</ref> and as such they surpass both [[kekkei genkai]] and [[kekkei tōta]].<ref name="c639"/> By combining the various natures inside the orbs, it is possible to produce a variety of effects.<ref name="d4"/> They are capable of instantly turning anything they touch to dust in a manner similar to [[Dust Release]],<ref name="c639"/> though this does not always occur.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 672, page 16</ref> If imbued with a certain [[Yin–Yang Release]] [[jutsu]], the orbs can nullify any [[ninjutsu]] they touch and thus become impervious to it; this includes negating the regenerative qualities of [[Impure World Reincarnation]], making it possible to permanently damage and kill those reincarnated by the technique.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 642, pages 4-5</ref> However, the orbs are incapable of nullifying [[senjutsu]],<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 642, pages 14-16</ref> as according to Naruto, [[natural energy]] can be used to combat itself.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 643, page 4</ref>

Naruto can use Truth-Seeking Balls to create his [[Tailed Beast Ball Rasenshuriken]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 676, page 13</ref> Similarly, Obito was able to convert one of his orbs into [[black receiver]]s, allowing him to use the [[Six Red Yang Formation]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 643, pages 9-11</ref><ref>Fourth Databook, page 255</ref> While in their default sphere form, the orbs can be launched as high-speed projectiles,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 666, page 5</ref> expanded to enormous sizes in an instant.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 640, pages 5-7</ref> Whatever their shape, users can only control the orbs within 70 metres of their location, allowing opponents to disable them by [[Space–Time Ninjutsu|transporting]] them elsewhere.<ref name="c669"/> If the user is killed or similarly incapacitated, their Truth-Seeking Balls will disintegrate alongside any black receivers they created.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 680, pages 10-11</ref>

=== Shape Transformation ===
Truth-Seeking Balls can be controlled individually or combined together; in both cases, by understanding the power of {{translation|"all things in nature"|森羅万象|Shinra Banshō}}, the orbs can be [[Shape Transformation|shaped]] into a variety of forms. Because the high-density chakra is in a condensed state, it can be pulled and stretched into a smooth and flat consistency, as well as freely manipulated into any other shape.<ref name="d4"/> [[Hiruzen Sarutobi]] theorised that there is a limit to how long the orbs can maintain a certain shape,<ref name="c639"/> though this was never confirmed. Most users are able to reshape their Truth-Seeking Balls without any special effort,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 673, page 1</ref> though Obito does so by passing them through holes that temporarily form in his hands.<ref name="c639"/> The orbs can also wrap around the user's body to form a protective shell.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 641, pages 8-9</ref> Though highly durable, this defence can still be broken by attacks that cannot be nullified, such as powerful senjutsu and [[taijutsu]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 651, pages 12-13</ref><ref>''Naruto'' chapter 669, pages 15-16</ref>

== Tenseigan Influence ==
[[File:Chakura no Juzu.png|thumb|left|Toneri's Truth-Seeking Ball infused with Tenseigan chakra.]]
While in Tenseigan Chakra Mode, Toneri could enhance his Truth-Seeking Balls by infusing them with glowing green chakra. Rather than simple black constructs, Toneri demonstrated the ability to transform one of these glowing orbs into an ornate golden cage. He could also combine them to create a [[Silver Wheel Reincarnation Explosion|massive vortex]] capable of blasting through the [[moon]]'s surface and a [[Golden Wheel Reincarnation Explosion|giant sword]] capable of cutting the entire moon in half.<ref name="The Last"/>

== Trivia ==
* The term {{translation|Truth-Seeker|求道|Kyūdō; Gudō}} comes from [[wikipedia:Mahayana|Mahāyāna Buddhism]]. The kanji 求 means ''to wish for'', while the {{translation|Way|道|Dō}} in Mahāyāna doctrine is to find the ultimate truth within one's own mind.
* If the Truth-Seeking Balls contain natural energy, users should not be able to add ninjutsu-negating Yin–Yang Release to them, as natural energy is precisely what causes other jutsu to become immune to erasure.
* Although they can nullify ninjutsu, the orbs can still be teleported away partly or wholly by [[Space–Time Ninjutsu]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 669, pages 14-15</ref>
* Despite stating that the orbs are wielded by Six Paths Senjutsu users, the [[Jin no Sho|fourth databook]] does not classify this technique as senjutsu.<ref name="d4"/>
* In ''[[Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4]]'' and ''[[Jump Force]]'', Truth-Seeking Balls give off a purple glow. In the former, Obito employs the orbs in several unique ways, such as forming scythes, drills, spinning disks, hands capable of firing Tailed Beast Balls and blasts of chakra.
* Despite repeatedly accessing his orbs every time he entered Six Paths Sage Mode during the [[Fourth Shinobi World War]], Naruto has not been seen accessing them since whenever using said form.
* In ''[[Naruto: Shinobi Collection Shippū Ranbu]]'', Obito has a technique called {{translation|"Truth-Seeking Ball: Trailokya Extinction"|求道玉・三界死滅|Gudōdama: Sangai Shimetsu}}, in which he combines his Truth-Seeking Balls into a single expanding orb that obliterates the surrounding area. The technique refers to the [[wikipedia:Trailokya|Trailokya]], the three realms of karmic rebirth in Buddhist cosmology.

The '''Allied Shinobi Forces Technique''' is a combination of many techniques devised by [[Shikaku Nara]], using the unique abilities of the [[Allied Shinobi Forces]] to combat the [[Ten-Tails]].

== Usage ==
The Allied Shinobi Forces Technique is focused on three primary goals; disrupt the opponents [[Sensing Technique|sensory]] abilities, restrain the Ten-Tails, and combat and remove [[Madara]] and [[Obito Uchiha]] from play. Using [[Inoichi]]'s [[Mind Body Switch Technique|telepathic]] abilities, Shikaku was able to relay the formation to every member of the alliance at once.

The first step would executed by the [[Kumo]]-nin, who would use [[Lightning Release: Lightning Illusion Flash of Lightning Pillar]] to temporarily blind the opponents and [[Storm Release: Laser Circus]] to create a cloud of dust. Next, [[Suna]]-nin would use their [[Wind Release: Air Current Wild Dance]] to manipulate the dust to further obscure the Uchiha's vision, while [[Aburame clan]] members and [[Kiri]]-nin would use their [[Insect Jamming Technique]] and [[Hiding in Mist Technique]] to impair their sensory skills. 

The second step, to restrain the Ten-Tails, would see the [[Iwa]]-nin create a large sink hole with their [[Earth Release: Great Moving Earth Core]], with their [[Lava Release|lava]] users covering the beast with [[Lava Release: Quicklime Congealing Technique|quicklime]], mixing it with the Kiri-nin's [[Water Release: Water Bullet Technique|water]]. [[Konoha]]'s [[Sarutobi clan]] would then [[Fire Release: Great Flame Technique|heat]] this mixture into concrete, trapping the Ten-Tails.

With the Ten-Tails restrained, the rest of the alliance would rush Madara and Obito using [[taijutsu]], having coordinated with [[Naruto]] to exploit their weaknesses.

== Trivia ==
* Despite the name, the Allied Shinobi Forces Technique is not a specific technique used by the army, but rather a collaboration of different techniques being used to achieve a single goal.
* Despite successfully restraining the Ten-Tails momentarily, the beast's further evolution allowed it to overpower its restraints before the Alliance had a chance to combat Madara and Obito directly.
* In ''[[Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4]]'', a shortened version of the formation is used instead, consisting only of the lowering of the Ten-Tails into the ground, and the concrete used to immobilise it.

* Both users have the stylised kanji for {{translation|"lightning"|雷|kaminari}} tattooed on their shoulders; Darui on his left and the Third on his right. * [[Sasuke Uchiha]] demonstrated the ability to use [[Chidori#Cursed Seal of Heaven Application|something]] resembling this when he fought against [[Naruto Uzumaki]] at the [[Valley of the End]] in Part I,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 232, page 11</ref> and when he [[Chidori#Six Paths Application|attacked]] [[Madara Uchiha]] in the [[Fourth Shinobi World War]] after receiving [[Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki]]'s power.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 674, page 11</ref>
* [[Kakashi Hatake]]'s [[Lightning Cutter|lightning attack]] also became [[Kamui Lightning Cutter|black in colour]] after receiving the [[Six Paths Power]] from [[Obito Uchiha]] while battling against [[Kaguya Ōtsutsuki]] in the Fourth Shinobi World War.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 689, page 9</ref>
* In the anime, [[Tsukiyo]] has displayed Lightning Release similar in appearance to this, though his has a magenta glow.<ref>''Boruto'' episode 146</ref>

This is a high-level form of [[medical ninjutsu]] that only [[Tsunade]] has been shown to have mastered. Tsunade creates an electric field by giving her chakra the properties of electricity. When she strikes a target with her hand, the electricity pours into their nervous system and rearranges their body's signals. Ordinarily, the brain sends electric signals to the body to control how it moves. But when under the influence of this technique, these signals will produce any movement ''other'' than what the brain intends. When used against most opponents, they will be unable to do something as simple as walking, much less continue fighting.<ref name="d2"/>

The target can partially overcome this technique if they manage to relearn the connection between their brain and their limbs, as [[Kabuto Yakushi]] demonstrates. However, this is not an easy feat and takes a high amount of concentration and intelligence.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 164, pages 16-17</ref>

== Trivia ==
* Because of how its entry in ''[[Tō no Sho]]'' is worded, it isn't clear if this qualifies as [[Lightning Release]].
* In ''[[Jump Ultimate Stars]]'', [[Sakura]] uses this technique by charging [[chakra]] in her hand and thrusting the opponent with her palm, causing damage and leaving the target confused.

'''Chidori Current''' is a [[ninjutsu]] that was developed by [[Sasuke Uchiha]] while he was training with [[Orochimaru]].

== Overview ==
By releasing the [[Chidori]] in every direction, an electrical discharge flows from the user's entire body allowing them to affect multiple enemies. When using this attack on a great number of enemies at once, it can effectively double as an instant defence. The body of the person touched by the Chidori will misinterpret the lightning nature as "electrical signals from the nerves", making its muscles contract. This causes the body to involuntarily go stiff, while at the same time receiveing damage. This attack can also be channelled through the ground to increase the range of the attack.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 384, page 11</ref>

The original [[Chidori]] gained its power by shaping it into a form sufficient for an electrical discharge and using it together with the user's own "thrust". This technique uses [[shape transformation]] to form the original Chidori into a spear or blade-shape, adapting it for mid-range attacks with a maximum range of about five metres.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 358, page 5</ref> Its increased range means there is less of a risk to the user. It also has the advantage of being able to be used for surprise attacks and capturing. 

When the enemy's body is pierced, the user can alter the spear's shape into multiple additional blades, increasing the number of wounds.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 367, page 5</ref> The blade can also be swung in order to cut things as well as cause fatal injuries. Sasuke has shown that he can also channel this technique through his [[Sword of Kusanagi (Sasuke Uchiha)|chokutō]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 634, pages 8-9</ref> 

Because of Sasuke's mastery in kenjutsu, this technique can act as a makeshift sword if he loses his sword.

After infusing this technique with [[Six Paths Chakra]], Sasuke was able to bisect through the [[Outer Path: Samsara of Heavenly Life Technique|revived]] [[Madara]] in his [[Jinchūriki Forms|jinchūriki form]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 674, page 15</ref>

== Trivia ==
* In the [[Naruto: Shippūden|anime]], this technique was shown off-screen before its proper début.<ref>''Naruto: Shippūden'' episode 89</ref>

The '''Chidori''' is a high concentration of [[lightning]] [[chakra]] channelled around the user's hand.

== Overview ==
The Chidori was created by [[Kakashi Hatake]] after he failed to apply his lightning-[[nature]] to the [[Rasengan]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 321</ref> He intended for the Chidori to be a weapon used only to protect friends and loved ones.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 177, page 8</ref> To perform, the user first gathers lightning to their hand; the high concentration of electricity produces a sound reminiscent of many birds chirping, hence the name.<ref name="c113">''Naruto'' chapter 113, page 15</ref> The lightning chakra has been shown on occasions to damage the user's hand, peeling the skin and causing it to smoulder slightly, but this does not appear to actually be debilitating.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 146, pages 13, 17</ref> Once the chakra is gathered, users charge at their target and thrust the Chidori into them, piercing them and typically causing fatal damage. Despite the sound it makes, the rapid speed at which it's used makes it useful for assassinations.<ref name="c113"/>

The speed at which the Chidori is performed, despite being one of its greatest assets, also represents one of its biggest drawbacks: the technique makes the users move at their target so fast that its causes a [[wikipedia:tunnel vision|tunnel vision]]-like effect for them. Because they charge in a straight line it is easy for opponents to attack them, and because of the tunnel vision it is difficult for the user to see these attacks, much less react to them. For this reason, most ninja cannot use the Chidori safely.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 240, page 14</ref> However, a user of the [[Sharingan]] can overcome these drawbacks due to its heightened visual perception preventing the tunnel vision from occurring and its predictive capabilities making it easier for the user to avoid counterattacks.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 244, pages 4-6</ref> [[Hidari]] despite having a pair of [[Rinnegan]] finds using the jutsu hard to control, and believes the Sharingan is needed to master it.<ref>''Boruto: Two Blue Vortex'' chapter 11, page 25</ref> Kakashi's skill with the Chidori eventually became so good that he was able to split a bolt of lightning with it, earning his Chidori the name "[[Lightning Cutter]]".<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 114, page 3</ref>

The Chidori requires a large amount of chakra to be performed, placing a limit on how many times it can be used per day. In Part I, Kakashi can use it four times per day<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 128, page 11</ref> and [[Sasuke Uchiha]] can use it twice per day under his own power.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 128, page 9</ref> Both increase their limits to an unspecified number in Part II. During Part II, Sasuke demonstrates several variations of the Chidori that have been given [[shape transformation]], such as [[Chidori Senbon]] and [[Chidori Sharp Spear]], both of which allow him to attack at a longer range than the Chidori is capable of.

== Trivia ==
* {{Translation|"Chidori"|千鳥}} can also be translated to "[[Wikipedia:Plover|plover]]".
* The name Chidori comes from a story about famous samurai [[Wikipedia:Tachibana Dōsetsu|Tachibana Dōsetsu]]: Tachibana was in possession of a famous sword called {{translation|Chidori|千鳥|lit meaning=A Thousand Birds}}. One day, while he was still a young man, he was taking shelter under a tree, as it was raining. Suddenly, a bolt of lightning struck him. However, Tachibana used his Chidori to cut the [[Wikipedia:Raijin|Thunder God]] inside the lightning bolt, allowing him to survive. After this incident, he renamed his Chidori to {{translation|Raikiri|雷切|lit meaning=Lightning Cutter}}.
* In the original ''Naruto'' anime, Chidori looks like a white, sphere-shaped amount of electricity that surrounds the palm. This is corrected in the ''Naruto: Shippūden'' anime, where the Chidori is depicted as it is in the manga: a formless coverage of electricity all over the hand.
** However, in the video game ''J-Stars Victory Vs''. and its ''+'' version, Sasuke's Chidori takes its incorrectly rendered sphere shape as aforementioned, but with the sphere contained within his hand (only during its startup animation and when Sasuke is running with the Chidori active).
* In both ''[[Naruto: Ultimate Ninja 2]]'' and ''[[Naruto: Ultimate Ninja 3|3]]'', players can customise some characters to be able to use Chidori. In the former case, it is called "Young Lightning" in the English script when used by Anbu Kakashi.
** Also, in some forms of media like the aforementioned games (along with ''[[Naruto: Gekitō Ninja Taisen! 4]]'' and ''[[Naruto: Clash of Ninja Revolution 2]]''), Sasuke in his Cursed Seal of Heaven state (both level 1 and 2) often has the ability to perform both the normal version of his Chidori and its Cursed Seal version as separate techniques.
** However, in ''[[Jump Super Stars]]'', despite using the Cursed Seal Chidori in his State 2 form for his Battle 7 Koma, Sasuke's Chidori is coloured purple akin to the State 1 version instead of dark-white.
* In the trailers for ''[[Boruto: Naruto the Movie]]'', [[Lightning Release Bullet: Powerful Breath]] makes the unique sound that Chidori makes.

<section begin=summary />The '''Expansive Truth-Seeking Ball''' is a Kekkei Mōra ninjutsu used by Kaguya Ōtsutsuki. It is composed of all five elemental [[Nature Transformation|nature transformations]] as well as [[Yin–Yang Release]].<ref name="chpt689">''Naruto'' chapter 689, page 7</ref><section end=summary />

== Usage ==
Kaguya Ōtsutsuki used the [[God Tree]] to absorb chakra from all the people trapped inside the [[God: Nativity of a World of Trees]] technique to create a maximised [[Truth-Seeking Ball]]. A vast expanding mass of chaos with power to reshape the world by obliterating it to nothing first. Unlike the standard Truth-Seeking Ball, which a user starts with a set amount of spheres that cannot be regenerated if lost or destroyed, this technique does not have such limitations and can be generated from nothing.

The sphere will continue to expand until it overwrites the previous dimension, completely annihilating it. If this happens, even previously synced [[Space–Time Ninjutsu]] will be unable to return to the new dimension.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 689, pages 7-8</ref>

== Trivia ==
* In the original publication of [[I Love You|chapter 689]], [[Black Zetsu]] lists [[Wood]] as one of the component natures of the Expansive Truth-Seeking Balls, rather than [[Water]].<ref name="chpt689"/> [[Masashi Kishimoto]] confirmed this was an error in Issue #41 of ''Weekly Shōnen Jump'', and stated that it would be corrected in the [[I Love You (volume)|tankōbon release]] of the chapter.<ref>Weekly Shōnen Jump Issue 41 Author Comments</ref>

== Variants ==
The intensity, size and strength of the technique can be proportionally increased by reducing the number of fingers involved:<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 554, page 13</ref>

* {{translation|'''Four-Finger Nukite'''|四本貫手|Yonhon Nukite|engtv=Piercing Four Fingered}}: Strong enough to break through [[Earth Release: Earth-Style Wall of Ten Thousand Ri|robust defences]] with relative ease.
* {{translation|'''Three-Finger Nukite'''|三本貫手|Sanbon Nukite|engtv=Three Fingered Assault}}: Effective against even [[Lava Release: Rubber Wall|malleable]] [[Lava Release: Rubber Ball|materials]] that can usually handle a blow by dissipating its force. By swinging his hand, the Third can create a shock-wave powerful enough to send opponents in the immediate area around him flying back.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 555, page 1</ref>
* {{translation|'''One-Finger Nukite'''|一本貫手|Ippon Nukite|engtv=One Fingered Assault}}: Thrusting into the target creates what is known as the {{translation|"''strongest spear''"|最強の矛|saikyō no hoko|engtv=invincible spear}}, where the concentration of chakra is so great that it extends well beyond the finger in a lone point. It was capable of cutting off all of [[Gyūki]]'s tails at once during an encounter and was even able to pierce the Third's own [[Lightning Release Chakra Mode]], backfiring the damage and scarring his body, which due to his immense durability that was well regarded as the {{translation|"''strongest shield''"|最強の盾|saikyō no tate}}.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 555, pages 13-15</ref> Depending on the situation, it can be also be used for vertical cuts, becoming a legendary sword.<ref name="d4" />

== Trivia ==
* A {{translation|nukite|貫手|lit meaning=crossbeam hand}} is a move used in martial arts like karate, where you strike the opponent with your finger stretched out. A {{translation|four-finger nukite|四本貫手|yonhon nukite}} uses the four fingers and, when aimed at the throat, is called a {{translation|hell stab|地獄突き|jigokuzuki}}. The {{translation|two-finger nukite|二本貫手|nihon nukite}} and {{translation|one-finger nukite|一本貫手|ippon nukite}} are also used. A {{translation|three-finger nukite|三本貫手|sanbon nukite}} seems to be somewhat rare.
* The [[Fourth Raikage]] used a similar technique in a fight against [[Gyūki]] to cut its horn off.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 494, page 2</ref>

'''Indra's Arrow''' is Sasuke Uchiha's strongest offensive technique.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 697, page 1</ref>

== Usage ==
After absorbing chakra from all nine [[tailed beasts]] and using his [[Complete Body — Susanoo]] as a vessel, Sasuke creates a longbow and arrow that are infused with lightning-natured chakra. It proved to be extremely powerful, able to match [[Naruto Uzumaki]]'s [[Six Paths: Ultra-Big Ball Rasenshuriken]] despite Lightning Release's inferiority to Wind Release.

== Influence ==
This technique draws influence from Hinduism, where [[wikipedia:Indra|Indra]], the god of thunder and wars, used a rainbow as a bow to fire arrows made of lightning; the thunderbolt is also said to be given the name Vajra, which is synonymous with diamond or adamantine in a Japanese context.

== Trivia ==
* This technique derives its name from [[Indra Ōtsutsuki]], the ancestor of the [[Uchiha clan]] and, in the manga, the first user of Susanoo.
* In ''[[Naruto x Boruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections]]'', Indra performs a similar variation, creating a spear of electricity.

== See Also ==
* ''[[Susanoo: Blade of Yachihoko]]''

'''Kirin''' is an extremely powerful [[Lightning Release]] technique created by [[Sasuke Uchiha]].

== Overview ==
Sasuke draws natural lightning directly from thunder clouds to supplement the power of his strike and controls it with chakra. Unlike most techniques, which are based on the user's chakra, this one uses the natural lightning, which — as noted by Zetsu — reaches the ground in 1/1000th of a second. However, the preparation time required also decreases the technique's efficiency. If there are no active thunder clouds, the user must create them by using powerful [[Fire Release|fire techniques]] to produce the necessary [[Wikipedia:Cumulonimbus cloud|storm conditions]]. With techniques such as [[Amaterasu]], even stronger storm conditions can be made by them.

Once a lightning source has been acquired, shaping and guiding the lightning to the target requires very little chakra. This technique was powerful enough to completely obliterate a [[Uchiha Hideout|small mountain]] and [[Itachi Uchiha]]'s [[Susanoo]].

Using this technique disperses the thunder clouds, and as such, it can only be used once in a fight. Conversely, however, because of the inextinguishable properties of techniques such as Amaterasu, it can be used to continuously create new thunder clouds to use Kirin once again; however, the process seems to require a bit of time.

== Influences ==
* In Japanese mythology, the [[Wikipedia:Qilin|Kirin]] is considered a holy creature, whose cry is a musical scale and whose footprints are perfect circles. It is very peaceful and careful, capable of walking on water and on grass without bending the blades. It doesn't eat meat either. It only appears in places ruled by a benevolent and wise leader and is well-known for punishing the wicked.
* In Japan, the Kirin is considered as the most powerful and divine as opposed to the [[wikipedia:Fenghuang|Hōō]], the rulers of birds — and is usually placed above all other mythological creatures, including the [[Wikipedia:Japanese dragon|ryū]] and Hōō. It can live up to a millennium and wounding one or coming across its corpse is considered a bad omen.

== Trivia ==
* {{translation|'''Kirin'''|キリン|Kirin}} is also the Japanese word for "[[Wikipedia:Giraffe|giraffe]]".
** Interestingly, in episode 51 of the ''[[Naruto SD: Rock Lee no Seishun Full-Power Ninden]]'' anime, when Sasuke uses this technique, a giraffe appears instead of a dragon. 
* In the Ultimate Ninja Storm game series, Sasuke has three chances of hitting the opponent with lightning from the sky, which when hit, will execute Kirin.
* The word {{translation|"Kirin"|麒麟|Chi: Qílín}} actually consists of two kanji where {{translation|'麒'|ki|Chi: qí}} is kanji for male Kirin and {{translation|'麟'|rin|Chi: lín}} is kanji for female Kirin.
* In ''[[Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Heroes 3]]'', Sasuke can use Kirin using his [[Sword of Kusanagi (Sasuke Uchiha)|sword]].
* In ''[[Rock Lee's Springtime of Youth Full Power Ninja Chronicles]]'', Kirin is literally a giant giraffe head that descends from the sky, once to kiss Sasuke to activate his trump card and the second time just to say "Giraffe".
* In chapter 309, when Sasuke was about to kill off Team 7, he took a stance similar to when he is about to use Kirin, but there were no thunderclouds or rain present. This is likely because Kishimoto had yet to design the concept for Kirin.
* In a 2023 interview with [[Sasuke Retsuden: The Uchiha Descendants and the Heavenly Stardust (manga)|''Sasuke Retsuden'']] illustrator Shingo Kimura, Kimura said that Kishimoto told him the art for Kirin was produced using the outline function on his old copy machine to whiten the interiors of his lines, leaving only black outlines. Upon looking at the art, Kimura determined he had repeated the process three times. According to Kimura, Kishimoto replaced his copy machine with a newer model that lacked the function, which is why he didn't draw the technique again.<ref>[https://naruto-official.com/en/news/01_1494?nolangsuggestion=1 Shingo Kimura Interview Part 3]</ref>

The '''Liger Bomb''' is a certain-kill technique used by the [[Fourth Raikage]].

== Usage ==
After covering himself in his [[Lightning Release Chakra Mode]], the Fourth Raikage grabs his opponent and lifts them high up into the air. Then, using his extreme strength, he smashes them head first onto the ground in what resembles a powerbomb manoeuvre. This is devastating enough to shatter a large area of the ground itself on impact. [[Darui]] noted that nobody has ever survived this attack before, and had [[Sasuke Uchiha]] not used his [[Susanoo]] to cushion the impact, he would have been killed by it. The impact of this technique was strong enough to snap the ribs of Sasuke's Susanoo.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 463, pages 6-7</ref>

== Trivia ==
* As with many of the techniques of [[Kumogakure]] [[shinobi]], this technique has an English name given kanji that somewhat match the pronunciation. Usually, the kanji would be pronounced as ''Raiga Bakudan''.
* "Liger Bomb" is also the name of an attack used in professional wrestling, most notably by [[Wikipedia:Jushin Liger|Jushin "Thunder" Liger]]. A Liger Bomb is, a sit down variation, of the common [[Wikipedia:Powerbomb|powerbomb]]. The nintaijustu used by [[Fourth Raikage|A]] is the same manoeuvre [[wikipedia:Dave Bautista|Batista]] utilises as his finisher, calling it the "Batista Bomb".

The '''Lightning Cutter''' is the special name for [[Kakashi Hatake]]'s [[Chidori]].

== Overview ==
Kakashi's Chidori gained the name "Lightning Cutter" when he used it to split a bolt of lightning.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 114, page 3</ref> Although this indicates greater finesse with Kakashi's Lightning Cutter than exists with the standard Chidori, it isn't clear how they differ because they are performed in fundamentally the same way: both concentrate [[lightning]] [[chakra]] in the hand; both are used to rapidly pierce targets; both cannot be safely used without the [[Sharingan]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 113, page 15</ref> When [[Deidara]] refers to [[Sasuke Uchiha]]'s jutsu as Lightning Cutter, Sasuke corrects him and explains that his jutsu is technically only a Chidori.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 361, page 14</ref>

Like the Chidori, the Lightning Cutter requires a large amount of chakra to be performed, placing a limit on how many times it can be used per day. In Part I, Kakashi can use it four times per day,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 128, page 11</ref> which he increases to an unspecified number in Part II. During Part II, Kakashi demonstrates several new uses for the Lightning Cutter, such as forming one in each hand to counteract [[Lightning Release: False Darkness|powerful lightning attacks]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 334, page 16</ref> On another occasion, he [[Lightning Transmission|link]]s his Lightning Cutter with one of his [[shadow clone]]'s, using the arc of electricity to cut through multiple targets.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 568, pages 4-5</ref> He can also [[flow]] it into [[kunai]], enhancing its slicing power and giving him a method of throwing the Lightning Cutter.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 595, pages 17-18</ref>
	
== Six Paths Application ==
[[File:Kamui Lightning Cutter.png|thumb|left|Kakashi's Lightning Cutter infused with the Six Paths Power.]]
While Kakashi's body is briefly inhabited by the spirit of [[Obito Uchiha]], he applies [[Six_Paths#Powers|Six Paths Power]] to his Lightning Cutter, allowing it to damage [[Kaguya Ōtsutsuki]]. He [[Kamui Lightning Cutter|combine]]s this usage with [[Kamui]], causing her counterattacks to pass through him harmlessly.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 689, pages 9-10</ref>
{{-L}}

== Trivia ==
* After losing his Sharingan as a result of [[Madara Uchiha]] stealing it during the [[Fourth Shinobi World War]], Kakashi no longer uses Lightning Cutter for safety reasons due to being unable to compensate for tunnel vision in his eyes. To counter this, in ''[[Kakashi Hiden]]'', Kakashi developed a new signature technique, [[Lightning Release: Purple Electricity]], which functions similarly to Lightning Cutter, albeit can be used safely without the Sharingan.
* The name Raikiri comes from a story about famous samurai, [[Wikipedia:Tachibana Dōsetsu|Tachibana Dōsetsu]]: Tachibana was in possession of a famous sword called {{translation|Chidori|千鳥|lit meaning=A Thousand Birds}}. One day, while taking shelter from the rain under a tree, a bolt of lightning struck him. However, Tachibana used his Chidori to cut the [[Wikipedia:Raijin|Thunder God]] inside the lightning bolt, allowing him to survive. After this incident, he renamed his Chidori to {{translation|Raikiri|雷切|lit meaning=Lightning Cutter}}.
* In the anime, the Lightning Cutter is usually depicted as blue, whereas the Chidori is depicted as white.
* In ''[[Kakashi Retsuden]]'', Kakashi encounters [[Hakubi Shin]], a rogue ninja from [[Konohagakure]] who claims to be able to use the Lightning Cutter. Although the technique is similar in appearance and how it's used, it's only an imitation that lacks the Lightning Cutter's raw power.
* In ''[[Naruto Shippūden the Movie: The Will of Fire]]'', when this technique was copied by [[Hiruko (missing-nin)|Hiruko]], he used the electrical energy to surge around the area, increasing the range of damage.
* In the crossover comic series ''[[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles x Naruto]]'', Kakashi performs a [[cooperation ninjutsu]] with [[w:c:turtlepedia:Leonardo (TMNT x Naruto)|Leonardo]] utilising the Lightning Cutter called '''Lightning Katana'''.<ref>''Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles x Naruto'' Issue 3, page 18</ref>

The user wraps their body in a layer of [[lightning]] [[chakra]] to increase their physical parameters, with more lightning causing greater increases. As users coat more lightning chakra around themselves, the more their hair sticks up.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 463, page 8</ref> The lightning augments the strength of the user's [[taijutsu]], creating what is called [[nintaijutsu]].<ref>''[[Kai no Sho]]'', page 120</ref> The lightning also defends the user from most attacks, deflecting them away on contact;<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 462, pages 16-17</ref> the [[Fourth Raikage]] is impressed when [[Chidori]] pierces through to him, however slightly.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 463, pages 2-3</ref>

The lightning chakra stimulates the user's nervous system, enhancing their speed and their reaction time.<ref name="c463">''Naruto'' chapter 462, page 3</ref> The user's reflexes are heightened enough to perform a {{Translation|'''Lightning Release [[Body Flicker]]'''|雷遁の瞬身|Raiton no Shunshin|engtv=Lightning Style: Teleportation}}, dodging attacks as fast as [[Amaterasu]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 463, pages 13-15</ref> The user is so fast that not even the [[Sharingan]] can track their movements;<ref name="c463"/> only [[Minato Namikaze]]'s [[Flying Thunder God Technique]] and [[Naruto Uzumaki]]'s [[Nine-Tails Chakra Mode]] have been shown to be faster.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 542, page 14</ref><ref>''Naruto'' chapter 544, pages 11-13</ref>

== Trivia ==
* In lieu of [[tailed beast]] chakra, the Fourth Raikage uses this mode to empower himself when performing the [[Lightning Release: Lariat]], producing the same effects due to his high-powered chakra.
* On the cover of [[The Five Kage Gathered…!! (volume)|volume 59]], the Fourth Raikage's Lightning Release Chakra Mode is shown to be yellow.

The '''Lightning Release: Double Lariat''' is a stronger version of the [[Lightning Release: Lariat]], whereby two users perform the technique from both behind and in front of the opponent, creating a scissor effect, up to close to light-speed.<ref name="d4" /> Both users must use the exact same amount of opposing strength or the target will merely bend.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 541, page 15</ref> When successfully done, the force of the technique will decapitate the target and send their head flying several metres into the air.

== Trivia ==
* As with many [[Kumogakure]] techniques, this technique has an English name given kanji that somewhat match the pronunciation. Usually, the kanji would be pronounced as ''Zetsugyū Rairi Nettō''.
* This technique is used as a test to see who will be worthy to become the [[Raikage]]'s [[A–B Combo|tag-team partner]], as the potential candidate must be able to synchronise their strength with the Raikage. As such, this technique is feared even outside of Kumogakure.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 542, page 7</ref>
* This move might be a reference to the move from the [[Wikipedia:Kinnikuman|Kinnikuman]] manga series called [[w:c:kinnikuman:Quarrel Bomber|Cross Bomber]] usually performed by [[w:c:kinnikuman:Neptuneman|Neptuneman]] and [[w:c:kinnikuman:Big the Budo (Neptune King)|Big The Budo]].

The user emits lightning  in the shape of a spear from its mouth, which then pierces the enemy. Its destructive power is great enough to even pierce through rock, meaning it has a high killing potential. The user can increase the number of spears to attack multiple enemies. This, coupled with the sheer speed of the lightning, makes it a difficult technique to evade. This technique is capable of being focused into a straight beam, similar to a laser. Kakuzu is able to use this through his [[Earth Grudge Fear#Masks|lightning-element mask]].

== Trivia ==
* Like the rest of Kakuzu's techniques, the name of this technique comes from the legendary mecha anime {{translation|''[[Wikipedia:Mobile Suit Gundam|Mobile Suit Gundam]]''|機動戦士ガンダム|Kidō Senshi Gandamu}}. The name Gian was taken from the [http://gundam.wikia.com/wiki/YMS-15_Gyan YMS-15] {{translation|''Gyan''|ギャン|Gyan}}. The name was altered slightly and given kanji to create the name of this technique.
* In ''[[Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 2]]'', Kakuzu uses what looks like the tiger seal to activate this technique, which can be seen in the Boss fight of [[Naruto]] and Kakuzu.

The '''Lightning Release: Lariat''' is a powerful taijutsu technique whereby the user charges at their opponent, striking them with a [[Wikipedia:Professional wrestling attacks#Lariat|Lariat]] move, which can be coated in [[chakra]]. A successful strike can blow away a target's entire chest with a direct hit, which may not kill them right away, but will ultimately kill them if they are not treated. The attack is rather straightforward, but very quick, powerful and is easily capable of knocking down an opponent.

== Variants ==
* When Killer B uses this attack, he creates either a [[Version 1|chakra cloak]] or [[Version 2|chakra bones]], both in the form of bull horns. He refers to this as his {{translation|"Eighth"|八本目|Happonme}} sword, next to his seven conventional katana. In Killer B's Version 2, the Lariat gains an increase in power due to the ox-skull he creates. He was able to pierce [[Samehada]] while simultaneously blowing away [[Kisame Hoshigaki]]'s chest.
* When A uses it, he surrounds himself with his [[Lightning Release Chakra Mode]], rather than tailed-beast chakra. His high-level chakra, which is comparable to that of a tailed beast's, would produce the same effect as Killer B's version. The two brothers can combine their efforts to perform a [[Lightning Release: Double Lariat]], which is strong enough to decapitate the victim, even without chakra enhancements, due to the brothers' immense physical strength.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 542, page 7</ref>

== Trivia ==
* This technique appears to be a signature skill that all Raikage are taught. Also, it is taught to the ninja, usually the Raikage's sibling, who earns the title of "B" so as to be a tag-team partner with the Raikage and be able to perform this technique [[Lightning Release: Double Lariat|simultaneously]] on the same target.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 541, page 13</ref>
* As with many of the techniques of [[Kumogakure]] ninja, this technique has an English name given kanji that somewhat match the pronunciation. Usually, the kanji would be pronounced as ''Rairi Nettō''.
* Similarly to the Fourth Raikage's [[Liger Bomb]], the Lariat is a highly feared move within [[Wikipedia:Puroresu|Puroresu]] (Japanese professional wrestling). Killer B even shouts "Wheee!" when attacking with the Lariat, a nod to pro wrestler [[Wikipedia:Stan Hansen|Stan Hansen]] who popularised the Lariat in Japan.
* In the ''[[Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Storm]]'', [[Might Guy]]'s "[[Oneself's Rule]]" shows him performing what appears to be a regular lariat.

* [[Wikipedia:Raijū|Raijū]] is a mythological creature in Shintō religion, companion to the Shintō god of lightning, Raijin. Raijū has many common representations, with a white and blue wolf sometimes engulfed in lightning being among them, akin to the form Kakashi's technique takes.
* In ''[[Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4]]'', Kakashi can only use this technique if [[Lightning Cutter]] is selected as his Ninjutsu attack, as this technique serves as the Lightning Cutter's charged Ninjutsu attack in the game.
* In multiple Storm titles, this technique is used in conjunction with [[Might Guy]]'s [[Daytime Tiger]] as part of their [[Eternal Rival (Ultimate Ninja Storm Revolution)|Combination Ultimate Jutsu]].

The '''Lightning Release: Lightning Illusion Flash of Lightning Pillar''' is a genjutsu that utilises lightning-natured chakra.

== Usage == 
The user discharges electricity through their entire body in the form of an extremely bright light to disorientate their target's vision. Once this is done, the user can implant images in their head, as seen when C made [[Jūgo]] see [[Sasuke]] getting smashed into the ground by the [[Fourth Raikage]]. This gives the user's allies the perfect opportunity to attack the unsuspecting victim.

This genjutsu can also be used collaboratively with other shinobi to completely overwhelm a target(s) sense of sight in the [[Fourth Shinobi World War]] against the [[Ten-Tails]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 612, pages 8-9</ref>

== Trivia ==
* In the manga, this attack generates an electric light emanating directly from C's body, however, in the anime, though light emanates from C's body, the electricity being discharged is not seen.

The user shoots a bolt of electricity from their hand to strike a target. It was invented by [[Kakashi Hatake]] as a replacement for the [[Lightning Cutter]], which he could no longer safely use after the loss of his [[Sharingan]]. In ''[[Kakashi Hiden]]'', Kakashi typically uses Purple Electricity to strike targets from a distance, though he does sometimes use it through direct contact, as when he places his hand on spilled alcohol in order to transmit Purple Electricity throughout the surrounding area. He can modulate the intensity of the Purple Electricity, creating a blast strong enough to remove a target's [[blue fire powder|explosive]] vest but without setting off the explosive or otherwise affecting the target. Conversely, he is later shown using all his [[chakra]] to perform a Purple Electricity powerful enough to induce the rain clouds he's falling through to start producing rain.

Purple Electricity has sometimes been shown used in ways reminiscent of the Lightning Cutter and Chidori, with the user gathering [[lightning]] into their hand and quickly striking targets with it,<ref>''Boruto'' chapter 21, pages 13-14</ref><ref>''Boruto'' episode 13 </ref> or using it similarly to the [[Chidori Current]], where the user releases bolts of purple lightning from all around their body in a omni-directional attack.<ref>''Boruto'' episode 37</ref><ref>''Boruto: Two Blue Vortex'' chapter 4, page 13</ref><ref>''Boruto: Two Blue Vortex'' chapter 23, page 15</ref> After mastering [[Uchiha Style Kenjutsu]] under Sasuke’s tutelage, Boruto learns to channel his own Purple Electricity through his blade, similar to [[Chidori Katana]].<ref>''Boruto: Two Blue Vortex'' chapter 6</ref>

== Trivia ==
* The term "shiden" is part of the idiom {{translation|"shiden'issen"|紫電一閃|lit meaning=violet electricity flash}}, which refers to a sword flash or a quick brandishing of a sword akin to lightning.
* Before his manga debut at using it, Boruto was listed as being able to use this jutsu himself.<ref name="BV1" /> In the anime, Boruto originally used this technique through the [[Shinobi Gauntlet]]. Boruto evidently could not use it himself at the time, as it was what tipped off [[Naruto Uzumaki]] that Boruto must be using the tool.<ref>''Boruto'' episode 61</ref>
* While he has yet to use the technique in the anime, Mitsuki is seen using it in the second version of the opening, [[BAKU (song)|BAKU]].

* This technique was used by the boss of a group of bandits that were stealing food supplies.
* The name of this jutsu appears to be a word play with the four character idiom 無知蒙昧, which refers to the unenlightened, uneducated, and ignorant.

This '''Lightning Water Dragon Bullet''' is a [[cooperation ninjutsu]] used by [[Mei Terumī]] and [[A (Fourth Raikage)|A]].

== Usage ==
After kneading chakra in her stomach and converting it into water, Mei expels it in the shape of a dragon. Taking advantage of the highly conductive nature of water, A then imbues the water dragon with lightning-natured chakra. When this technique makes contact with a target, it numbs their body, thereby dulling their movements and leaving them susceptible to other attacks.

'''Limelight''' is a lightning-based technique that is used when all four users take place in the cardinal directions. They will then join their lightning-[[chakra]] in the form of four connecting streams that shoot high into the sky above the target area. It will then create a massive ball of lightning powerful enough to incinerate everything within the area of the four users. It is considered to be the most powerful and destructive [[Lightning Release]] technique. While walking towards their designated positions, the users will generate fluctuating pillars of electricity from their bodies.<ref>''Naruto: Shippūden'' episode 66</ref> 

As the technique requires all four users to be in position, if even one of them is disabled, then Limelight cannot activate at all.

== Trivia ==
* The technique's name is a pun, similar to certain techniques of [[Kumogakure]]-ninja, in which it has an English name with a given kanji that somewhat matches the pronunciation.

Even when applied to a pencil, the channeling of [[lightning]]-natured chakra increases its vibrating frequency and hence its piercing and cutting power, to an extent that exceeds those of standard [[Wind Release]] techniques.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 470, page 12</ref> A sword empowered by this chakra flow proved capable of blocking [[Sword of Kusanagi (Sasuke Uchiha)|another sword]] even [[Sword of Kusanagi: Chidori Katana|imbued with the Chidori]],<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 411, pages 17</ref> which was considered impossible to defend against.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 411, page 16</ref><ref>''Naruto'' chapter 308, page 9, panel 3</ref> However, if the chakra flow is absorbed before the flowed object pierces, the added potency will have no effect.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 470, page 13</ref> 

== Trivia ==
* Although the name of this technique implies a sword, ''[[Jin no Sho]]'' indicates this is the method of chakra flow, used even on other objects.

'''Truth-Seeking Balls''' are orbs of malleable black [[chakra]], which can alter their form and characteristics in various ways. Though only the size of a fist, each hides within it the power to obliterate an entire forest.<ref name="d4"/>

== Acquisition ==
Those who awaken [[Six Paths Senjutsu]] are able to wield Truth-Seeking Balls.<ref name="d4"/> [[Hagoromo]] and [[Hamura Ōtsutsuki]] appear to have possessed this power naturally,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 690, page 4</ref> whereas others may obtain it by [[Six Paths Ten-Tails Coffin Seal|becoming]] the [[jinchūriki]] of the [[Ten-Tails]], or by receiving it directly from Hagoromo. Entering [[Tenseigan Chakra Mode]] also grants the user Truth-Seeking Balls.<ref name="The Last">''[[The Last: Naruto the Movie]]''</ref>

The number of Truth-Seeking Balls acquired varies from user to user. Acquisition method may determine the number, as both [[Obito Uchiha]] and [[Madara Uchiha]] gained ten orbs upon becoming the Ten-Tails' jinchūriki; Obito initially only formed two,<ref name="c639">''Naruto'' chapter 639, pages 6-8</ref> obtaining the other eight upon gaining control of the Ten-Tails' power.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 640, page 14</ref> Upon receiving power from Hagoromo, [[Naruto Uzumaki]], instead gained nine orbs,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 674, page 1</ref> while [[Asura Ōtsutsuki]] only showed five orbs,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 670, page 17</ref> nine orbs in the anime.<ref>''Naruto: Shippūden'' episode 468</ref> [[Toneri Ōtsutsuki]] is depicted with an inconsistent amount.<ref name="The Last"/> Due to having previously been the Ten-Tails' jinchūriki,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 666, page 6</ref> Obito was able to manifest a single Truth-Seeking Ball after  [[Chakra Absorption Techniques|absorbing]] some of Madara's [[Six Paths Chakra|power]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 665, pages 16-17</ref>

== Usage ==
When not in use, Truth-Seeking Balls generally float behind the user's back in a circular formation, though two of Obito's float behind his hands,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 643, page 4</ref> Hagoromo's float beneath him while levitating,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 670, page 2</ref> and Hamura's instead form a sigmoidal formation.<ref name="The Last"/> The orbs are always on standby once created,<ref name="c669">''Naruto'' chapter 669, pages 6-7</ref> and users cannot create additional orbs after the initial acquisition number; thus, orbs that are lost for whatever reason cannot be replaced. In Naruto's case, the orbs currently under his control disappear and reappear alongside his [[Six Paths Sage Mode|chakra cloak]],<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 695, page 4</ref> while the orbs he has discarded remain active.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 660, page 10</ref> [[Clone]]s are not created with orbs of their own,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 675, page 10</ref> though the user can temporarily transfer them to a clone.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 686, pages 10-11</ref>

Truth-Seeking Balls encompass the power of all five basic [[nature]]s,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 689, page 5</ref> and as such they surpass both [[kekkei genkai]] and [[kekkei tōta]].<ref name="c639"/> By combining the various natures inside the orbs, it is possible to produce a variety of effects.<ref name="d4"/> They are capable of instantly turning anything they touch to dust in a manner similar to [[Dust Release]],<ref name="c639"/> though this does not always occur.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 672, page 16</ref> If imbued with a certain [[Yin–Yang Release]] [[jutsu]], the orbs can nullify any [[ninjutsu]] they touch and thus become impervious to it; this includes negating the regenerative qualities of [[Impure World Reincarnation]], making it possible to permanently damage and kill those reincarnated by the technique.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 642, pages 4-5</ref> However, the orbs are incapable of nullifying [[senjutsu]],<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 642, pages 14-16</ref> as according to Naruto, [[natural energy]] can be used to combat itself.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 643, page 4</ref>

Naruto can use Truth-Seeking Balls to create his [[Tailed Beast Ball Rasenshuriken]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 676, page 13</ref> Similarly, Obito was able to convert one of his orbs into [[black receiver]]s, allowing him to use the [[Six Red Yang Formation]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 643, pages 9-11</ref><ref>Fourth Databook, page 255</ref> While in their default sphere form, the orbs can be launched as high-speed projectiles,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 666, page 5</ref> expanded to enormous sizes in an instant.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 640, pages 5-7</ref> Whatever their shape, users can only control the orbs within 70 metres of their location, allowing opponents to disable them by [[Space–Time Ninjutsu|transporting]] them elsewhere.<ref name="c669"/> If the user is killed or similarly incapacitated, their Truth-Seeking Balls will disintegrate alongside any black receivers they created.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 680, pages 10-11</ref>

=== Shape Transformation ===
Truth-Seeking Balls can be controlled individually or combined together; in both cases, by understanding the power of {{translation|"all things in nature"|森羅万象|Shinra Banshō}}, the orbs can be [[Shape Transformation|shaped]] into a variety of forms. Because the high-density chakra is in a condensed state, it can be pulled and stretched into a smooth and flat consistency, as well as freely manipulated into any other shape.<ref name="d4"/> [[Hiruzen Sarutobi]] theorised that there is a limit to how long the orbs can maintain a certain shape,<ref name="c639"/> though this was never confirmed. Most users are able to reshape their Truth-Seeking Balls without any special effort,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 673, page 1</ref> though Obito does so by passing them through holes that temporarily form in his hands.<ref name="c639"/> The orbs can also wrap around the user's body to form a protective shell.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 641, pages 8-9</ref> Though highly durable, this defence can still be broken by attacks that cannot be nullified, such as powerful senjutsu and [[taijutsu]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 651, pages 12-13</ref><ref>''Naruto'' chapter 669, pages 15-16</ref>

== Tenseigan Influence ==
[[File:Chakura no Juzu.png|thumb|left|Toneri's Truth-Seeking Ball infused with Tenseigan chakra.]]
While in Tenseigan Chakra Mode, Toneri could enhance his Truth-Seeking Balls by infusing them with glowing green chakra. Rather than simple black constructs, Toneri demonstrated the ability to transform one of these glowing orbs into an ornate golden cage. He could also combine them to create a [[Silver Wheel Reincarnation Explosion|massive vortex]] capable of blasting through the [[moon]]'s surface and a [[Golden Wheel Reincarnation Explosion|giant sword]] capable of cutting the entire moon in half.<ref name="The Last"/>

== Trivia ==
* The term {{translation|Truth-Seeker|求道|Kyūdō; Gudō}} comes from [[wikipedia:Mahayana|Mahāyāna Buddhism]]. The kanji 求 means ''to wish for'', while the {{translation|Way|道|Dō}} in Mahāyāna doctrine is to find the ultimate truth within one's own mind.
* If the Truth-Seeking Balls contain natural energy, users should not be able to add ninjutsu-negating Yin–Yang Release to them, as natural energy is precisely what causes other jutsu to become immune to erasure.
* Although they can nullify ninjutsu, the orbs can still be teleported away partly or wholly by [[Space–Time Ninjutsu]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 669, pages 14-15</ref>
* Despite stating that the orbs are wielded by Six Paths Senjutsu users, the [[Jin no Sho|fourth databook]] does not classify this technique as senjutsu.<ref name="d4"/>
* In ''[[Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4]]'' and ''[[Jump Force]]'', Truth-Seeking Balls give off a purple glow. In the former, Obito employs the orbs in several unique ways, such as forming scythes, drills, spinning disks, hands capable of firing Tailed Beast Balls and blasts of chakra.
* Despite repeatedly accessing his orbs every time he entered Six Paths Sage Mode during the [[Fourth Shinobi World War]], Naruto has not been seen accessing them since whenever using said form.
* In ''[[Naruto: Shinobi Collection Shippū Ranbu]]'', Obito has a technique called {{translation|"Truth-Seeking Ball: Trailokya Extinction"|求道玉・三界死滅|Gudōdama: Sangai Shimetsu}}, in which he combines his Truth-Seeking Balls into a single expanding orb that obliterates the surrounding area. The technique refers to the [[wikipedia:Trailokya|Trailokya]], the three realms of karmic rebirth in Buddhist cosmology.

The '''Vanishing Rasengan''' is a [[Lightning Release]] version of the [[Rasengan]], that was created by [[Boruto Uzumaki]], and named by [[Sasuke Uchiha]].

== Usage ==
After creating a small Rasengan, Boruto subconsciously adds Lightning Release to it, before throwing it. As it glides, the [[nature transformation]] abruptly kicks in,<ref>''Boruto: Naruto the Movie'' novel</ref> resulting in the technique disappearing from sight. This adds an element of surprise to the attack, as an opponent may lower their guard, assuming that the technique has dispersed, only to find themselves struck by the invisible attack. The size of Boruto's Vanishing Rasengan has seen a significant increase after the [[Mujina Bandits Arc]], where it was shown to be around the size of a regular Rasengan. With enough chakra added to it, the Rasengan can become [[Parent and Child Rasengan|giant]].

In the anime, [[Kakashi Hatake]] notes that the invisible nature comes by a loss in offensive power, rendering this technique as incomplete.<ref>''Boruto'' episode 168</ref> [[Momoshiki Ōtsutsuki]] himself later noted that it is too weak to cause a mortal wound, but is quite painful when it strikes a vital point.<ref>''Boruto'' chapter 54, page 26</ref>

== Trivia ==
* In the ''[[Boruto: Naruto the Movie]]'' novelisation, this technique was stated to use a subconscious application of [[Wind Release]] instead of Lightning Release.
* In the anime, [[Naruto]] was able to throw a standard Rasengan, similar to the main function of this technique.<ref>''Naruto'' episode 194</ref>
* In various media, when Boruto uses this technique, he simply calls it "Rasengan".
{{ImgRight|Orange Vanishing Rasengan.png|An orange-coloured Vanishing Rasengan.}}
* In [[Boruto OVA]], this technique was depicted as orange in colour, similarly to how the original Rasengan is sometimes depicted being yellow in the manga when used by Naruto, and orange on one Jump cover.<ref>''Boruto'' OVA</ref><ref>''Weekly Shōnen Jump'' 2005, Issue #35</ref>

The '''Acrobat''' is a kenjutsu used by [[Killer B]] in tandem with his [[Kumogakure Swords|swords]] and the standard technique of his unique [[Disturbance Taijutsu]] fighting style.

== Usage ==
When in battle, B holds his swords in a peculiar and unique manner. More often than employing his hands, B would wield his blades in and between various parts of his body. The first two are held in the hinge joint of his right and left arm, another between his shoulder blade and neck, one in his mouth, under his left armpit, another between the hip joint of his right, raised leg and the back leg of the same raised leg. As strange as it seems, Killer B is extremely skilled with these blades and this fighting style which he began adopting since a young age.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 542, page 6</ref> The most dangerous aspect of this style is the unpredictability of his movements, easily catching his opponents by surprise. He can spin in a manner similar to a buzz-saw, or else employing a series of unrelenting attacks switching the locations as well as the blades with which he attacks, leaving no openings for even a skilled [[Sharingan]] user like [[Sasuke Uchiha]],<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 411, page 14</ref> and a highly trained [[Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist|swordsman]] like [[Suigetsu Hōzuki]], who remarked that the method of attack was completely unpredictable.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 411, page 15</ref> Killer B was also able to throw these swords from their normally awkward positions, either to hit his opponents from range, or to impale his opponent at close range and cause damage that would normally be lethal.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 411, page 18</ref>

The swords can be [[Chakra Flow|charged]] with [[Lightning Release|lightning]] [[chakra]] to greatly increase their cutting power through high-frequency vibrations.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 411, page 17</ref> Because of the streamline shape of these swords, they serve as fairly good projectiles as well.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 550, page 3</ref> In the anime Killer B was able to use the [[Eight-Tails]]' tentacle to extend his reach for a surprise attack.<ref>''Naruto: Shippūden'' episode 298</ref>

== Trivia ==
* As with many techniques of [[Kumogakure]] ninja, this technique has an English name given kanji that somewhat match the pronunciation.

This is a [[sealing technique]] that is characteristic of the [[Uzumaki clan]].<ref name="d4"/> Users produce chains made out of their own [[chakra]], which typically emerge from their torso. Users control the chains as they extend outwards from their body, most commonly to wrap around targets and restrain them.<ref name="c498">''Naruto'' chapter 498</ref> The chains are extremely durable, enough that even the [[Nine-Tails]] would struggle to destroy them.<ref name="d4"/> In the anime, in addition to physically binding targets, the chains are said to neutralise their target by binding and nullifying their chakra.<ref>''Naruto: Shippūden'' episode 408</ref> Depending on the number and the length of chains that users intend to produce, they may prefer to initially create only a few chains, which they send underground to split apart and spread around the area as needed, leaving their immediate surroundings uncluttered.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 503</ref>

<gallery type="slideshow" position="left" widths="200" hideaddbutton="true">
Adamantine Sealing Chains.png|The chains creating a barrier.
Kurama sealed within Kushina.png|The chains binding the Nine-Tails within Kushina's subconscious.
</gallery>
A [[barrier]] can be erected between two or more sealing chains, which is quite impregnable: [[Kushina Uzumaki]] creates such a barrier to not only prevent the Nine-Tails from escaping a defined area, but also to prevent the [[Third Hokage]] from entering it.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 504</ref> Because the chains are made of the user's chakra, the chains can be produced anywhere the user's chakra resides. When she was the Nine-Tails' [[jinchūriki]], Kushina used the chains to bind the Nine-Tails within her subconscious,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 501</ref> and for this reason she never once lost control of its power.<ref name="d4"/> After her death, some of Kushina's chakra was sealed within her son, [[Naruto Uzumaki]], allowing her to produce the chains from his body in order to help him combat the Nine-Tails.<ref name="c498"/>

During the [[Fourth Shinobi World War]], [[Karin]] awakens the ability to produce similar chains, which she uses to lash against and ultimately destroy a [[wood]]en opponent. [[Orochimaru]] labels this the same ability as Kushina possessed,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 663</ref> but ''[[Jin no Sho]]'' describes it only as a "glimpse" of Kushina's Adamantine Sealing Chains.<ref name="d4"/>

After using the [[Multiple Shadow Clone Technique]], [[Naruto Uzumaki]] and his shadow clones simultaneously throw [[shuriken]] at a target. Because of how many shuriken there are and how many directions they're thrown from, the target, regardless of how skilled they may be, cannot reasonably dodge all of them.<ref name="d2"/> As such, their only real option is to try and shield themselves to minimise the damage.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 134</ref> This focus on the shuriken inevitably creates blind-spots in the target, which is the actual purpose of this technique: the many Narutos can focus on these blind-spots to execute [[Naruto Uzumaki Two Thousand Combo|additional attack]]s.<ref name="d2"/>

== Trivia ==
* {{translation|"Four directions, eight directions"|四方八方|Shihōhappō}} is an idiom meaning "from everywhere", "in all directions". The four directions are the cardinal directions: North, East, South, and West. The eight directions are these four and their halfway points: North-East, South-East, South-West, and North-West.

<section begin=summary />A certain-kill technique, the user hardens their own bones and protrudes them out of the skin, and then fires these weaponised structures from their back or from their palms at the intended target. When these bones pierce a living organism, the bone and target starts to deteriorate at a molecular level, disintegrating the victim and reducing their bodies to nothing more than a pile of ash.<section end=summary />

Kaguya has used this attack in a variety of ways: as a projectile attack, incorporating the use of her [[Yomotsu Hirasaka|dimension-manifesting]] abilities to land a two-sided attack as well as a close-range melee attack.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 686, page 6</ref>

Unlike other certain-kill techniques, in which the victim can survive if they possess extraordinary endurance, this technique is guaranteed to kill the victim if it connects and thus, truly lives up to the name of certain-kill techniques.

== Trivia ==
* [[Black Zetsu]] gained access to this technique while he was residing inside the sleeve of Kaguya's severed arm, controlling the severed limb to generate and fire bones.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 689, page 11</ref>
* The [[Shikotsumyaku]] [[kekkei genkai]] is derived from Kaguya's ability to manipulate and weaponise her own bone structure.<ref>Fourth Databook, page 25</ref>
* In ''[[Naruto: Shinobi Collection Shippū Ranbu]]'', Kaguya has techniques named {{translation|"All-Killing Ash Bones: Annihilation"|共殺の灰骨・皆滅|Tomogoroshi no Haikotsu: Kaimetsu}} and {{translation|"All-Killing Ash Bones: Demon Wail Formation"|共殺の灰骨・鬼哭陣|Tomogoroshi no Haikotsu: Kikokujin}}, both of which utilise numerous [[Yomotsu Hirasaka]] portals to launch a barrage of bone spears at her enemy.

== Influence ==
The name of this technique is derived from the pillar built by [[wikipedia:Izanagi|Izanagi]] and [[wikipedia:Izanami|Izanami]] in preparation for their mating.

* While unnamed in the anime, this technique was named in ''[[Naruto: Shinobi Collection Shippū Ranbu]]''.
* [[wikipedia:Rahu|Rahu]] is one of the nine celestial bodies in Hindu texts and the king of the meteors. It represents the ascension of the Moon in its precessional orbit around the Earth. In Japanese however, Rahu would be actually formatted as "Ragō" (羅喉).

<section begin=summary />Using her [[Rinne Sharingan]], [[Kaguya Ōtsutsuki]] replaces the world around her with one of her [[Kaguya's Dimensions|personal dimensions]]; everyone near Kaguya at the time will experience the same change of place.<ref name="d4"/> Unlike most [[space–time ninjutsu]], where users move themselves to a destination, Kaguya moves the destination to herself.<ref name="c680">''Naruto'' chapter 680, pages 1-4</ref> To relocate such large dimensions requires an immense amount of [[chakra]], so much so that only Kaguya is able to do so.<ref name="d4"/><section end=summary /> However, even she will start to tire out if she uses Amenominaka too much.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 684, page 13</ref> To an onlooker, Kaguya and everyone else will appear to simply vanish from the previous dimension they were in, without even a detectable trace of their chakra left behind.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 680, page 10</ref>

Those affected by Amenominaka will maintain their positions relative to each other between dimensions, so that somebody approaching Kaguya in one dimension will still be approaching her in the next. Because Amenominaka works on everybody in the vicinity of Kaguya, she cannot use it to escape from attackers or to transport only certain individuals to other dimensions; for both purposes, she instead relies on [[Yomotsu Hirasaka]].<ref name="c682">''Naruto'' chapter 682</ref> Kaguya does seem to have some control over where she and the others will appear within a dimension, giving her a strategic option: when first depicted, she shifts high into the air of her lava dimension, leaving her opponents to fall into the molten sea below;<ref name="c680"/> when she is being attacked by [[Naruto Uzumaki]] and [[Sasuke Uchiha]], she shifts to a part of her ice dimension that places Naruto and Sasuke within a glacier, trapping them and thus stopping their attack.<ref name="c682"/>

When [[Kakashi Hatake]] first experiences Amenominaka, he believes it is the result of a [[genjutsu]] because of how suddenly it happens and how stark the change is from where he was ([[Geography|Earth]]). It is only from noticing that the new world is too vast in size and intricate in detail that he realises it cannot be a mere illusion.<ref name="c680"/> He nevertheless revisits the genjutsu comparison later, noting that - from his perspective - Kaguya seems to be instantly rewriting reality with each use of Amenominaka.<ref name="c682"/>

== Trivia ==
* This technique's name comes from {{translation|[[wikipedia:Amenominakanushi|Amenominakanushi]]|天之御中主神|Heavenly Ancestral God of the Originating Heart of the Universe}}, a Japanese deity who is said to be the [[Wikipedia:Absolute (philosophy)|absolute centre]] of the universe, as well as the first [[wikipedia:Hitorigami|Hitorigami]] that came in to existence, and one of the five [[wikipedia:Kotoamatsukami|Kotoamatsukami]].
* ''[[Ultimate Ninja Storm 4]]'' gives each dimensional shift a unique name; Amenominaka: {{translation|"Lava"|熔|Yō|lit meaning=Corrosion}}, {{translation|"Ice"|氷|Hyō}}, {{translation|"Sand"|砂|Masago}}, as well as one for returning from her dimensions, {{translation|"Return"|戻|Modoshi}}.
